title: This rare asteroid sample is unveiling some of the Solar Systems biggest secrets
content:
Just over 12 months ago, we were sitting at Woomera, in the Australian outback, waiting for a streak of light in the sky to testify that the Hayabusa2 spacecraft had returned from its voyage to collect a little piece of a near-Earth asteroid called Ryugu. Unfortunately for us, it was cloudy in Woomera that day and we didnâ€™t see the spacecraft come in. But that was the only imperfection we saw in the return. We found and retrieved Hayabusa2, brought it back to Woomera, cleaned and examined it. Scientists preparing the sample capsule for analysis. Trevor Ireland, Author provided The…

This story continues at The Next Web
description: Just over 12 months ago, we were sitting at Woomera, in the Australian outback. Now, we have finally been able to example the sample.
